Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool

Class Pen

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.graphics.tool.Pen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PenInterface
    public class Pen
extends java.lang.Object
implements PenInterface
    A class that acts as a pen - e.g. has a current location, color, movement direction, distance to move... It will generate line segments that are added to the drawing surface The pen is given an instance of a drawing surface on which it will draw.
    Author:
    readda

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      private class  Pen.MyPoint
      A point that stores the coordinates as doubles.

        private int currentDirection

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pen

        public Pen​(DrawingSurface drawingSurface)
        Create the pen with a default color of black and a location of the origin (0,0). The default drawing direction is right (direction set to 0).
        Parameters:
        drawingSurface - The drawing surface that the pen will draw on

    • Method Detail

      • setDrawingSurface

        public void setDrawingSurface​(DrawingSurface drawingSurface)
        Set the DrawingSurface instance in which this pen is placed. Generally this is set by the addPen method of the DrawingSurface.
        Parameters:
        drawingSurface - The drawingSurface used by this pen

      • changeDirection

        public void changeDirection​(int adjustAngleDegrees)
        Description copied from interface: PenInterface
        Change the drawing direction for the pen based on the current drawing direction.
        Specified by:
        changeDirection in interface PenInterface
        Parameters:
        adjustAngleDegrees - The adjustment to the drawing angle in degrees. Positive values change the direction clockwise, negative values chance the direction counter-clockwise.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection​(int angleDegrees)
        Description copied from interface: PenInterface
        Set the drawing direction for the pen.
        Specified by:
        setDirection in interface PenInterface
        Parameters:
        angleDegrees - The direction or drawing based on a 360 degree circle. 270 degrees is up (north). 0 degrees is right (east)

      • calcDestinationPoint

        private java.awt.Point calcDestinationPoint​(int distance)
        Calculate a destination point using the current direction and supplied distance. It converts the current direction from degrees to radians and then uses cosine and sine of the radians to compute the new X and Y locations.
        Parameters:
        distance - The length of the line to draw (in pixels)
        Returns:
        The point. This will be an instance of MyPoint so that rounding errors do not accumulate by converting back to integers after each segment is drawn
